content.description: This one of those problems that is both really bad and fun at the same time.  It's located on the back side of the smaller boulder in the rear and climbs the rounded, left-trending arete (right hand) and crack then the arete (left hand).  I started by standing and kind of falling into it with my hands on the right arete and feet out wide.  There is likely a hard sit.
content.protection: Pads.  The rock in the crack is iffy in places but can be avoided.
content.location: See above.  On the back of the read boulder is cool, little roof topped with a sort of barrel shaped piece of rock.  Get into it.

content.description: Sit start with a good crimp bar, move up left to a good flake, and top out.
content.location: Start about 7-8 feet left of the problem Slightly Salted.

content.description: Stand start the Anvil on the face left and around the corner from Cracked Anvil. There are some good holds and several ways to get up - this is a good warm-up.
Stand start the right side of the face, as for Hooptie Ride, then make some fun balancy moves straight up and over the top.
content.protection: A pad - there is a flat landing.

content.location: It is about 15 feet left of the crack.

content.description: Climb the fat end/arete of the cool thin boulder from the sit. Start with nice foot holds and hand holds on either side, then work up, and choose your adventure to the top.

Around the back of the large boulder there is a sheer crimpy face.   Stand start the face on the right and work up and left to the good horizontal crack on the upper left.  Traverse the crack to the topout.   

  I stuck to the face and avoiding using holds on the top.  Feeling around up there might drop the grade.
content.protection: Pad.  There is a good landing.

content.location: It is on the boulder that looks like an anvil.

content.description: This a collection of three blocks of different sizes near the path pretty deep in the woods.   The main attraction here is the large boulder that looks like the head of an anvil.  It is certainly cool looking but lacks great problems.   There used to be a pretty curtain of vines that came down form the top of this boulder, but someone has recently pulled this off.
